Author: CrisF#3405
Content: @blackjok3r What do people mean when they talk about `reset their wallet.dat`?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: we have scripts for that in StakedNotary have a read of them if you want to know how it works.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
basically 
sends all funds into a singl utxo
removes wallet.dat
then imports the private key containing those funds wihtout rescanning the chain
rescans chain back a few blocks to see that one transaction

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The wallet.dat uses BerkelyDB which gets very slow after it has a lot of transactions in in... the wallet holds every transaction ever made with its keys, not just teh  keys and balance.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Can anything be sent through this?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: You mentioned MM.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes anything can e sent ... its up to the application on how it will use the streamid and generate/assemble the data

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To start with, I will just have a script that starts the marketmaker up with a bash script (as thats what I have and it works)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then a python script that can send small files in a single RPC to marketmaker

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: witch then splits that data up into 8kb chunks and sends them as raw transactions with komodod

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then in komodod there is a new RPC that will return all data in a block all joined together in a single chunk and a range of sequence ids and the streamid and the blockheight of the first block the stream started in.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so the python script to get the data for now, will need to be given a block to start from, and it will iterate over sequential blocks until it gets to an empty block then output the file

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the way I am doing it, means that large files cannot be sent using this method ... but I think reading the file in chunks and sending will be pretty easy to add

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: same on recv side after its done  X blocks inot memory, write to disk, then continue.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this code will be well commented and in python so other devs can easily see how to use it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: for video stream, the reveiving app, would start the daemon with blocknotify, which will push the blockhash to the app on receiv of each block, the app can then call `getdatafromblock` RPC on that blockhash to extract all data in the block, so it will have the data in realtime.

Author: CrisF#3405

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: currently this particular script reads the whole file into memory in a single peice so maybe 20-30mb at a guess

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: thats not really hard to fix though, I just like to start with the simplest thing and then add more on later, as less can go wrong that way

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the longest time, is calling all the calls in the right order, but a good dAPP will handle all that very easily... might need something in the blast loop that writes out a file or something so that the dapp knows the blaster is primed.
